title: Ayebabara
author: Ayebabara
content: What I noticed in the forum today, though this is my second post in the forum. After my registration I forgot my login details, but today I was lucky to to recover the details. When I login, and I saw my home page is different from my uncle's interface. There are some things that I saw in my uncle's own does not appear on my own. My home page starts from Economics but others start from Bitcoin discussion.

comments.author: jackg
comments.body: Have you refreshed the page and still got the same thing?You could go here to see if this is causing the problem - boards you want to see should be unchecked? https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?action=profile;sa=ignoreBoards

comments.author: Yogee
comments.body: Check if you accidentally hidden the Bitcoin discussions boards. If that's the case then you should see a "+ Bitcoin" on the top left side of your screen under the "Bitcoin Forum" and just above the "-Economy". Just click the "+" sign to unhide the Bitcoin boards.

comments.author: Xal0lex
comments.body: As far as I know, when a user logs in to the forum under his username and password, then after a successful login the main page of the forum is loaded. And then, from the main page of the forum, you already go where you want. In any case, that's how the forum works for me. Or is that not what you meant?

comments.author: Dunamisx
comments.body: Quote from: Ayebabara on November 29, 2022, 04:02:00 PMThere are some things that I saw in my uncle's own does not appear on my own. My home page starts from Economics but others start from Bitcoin discussion. Just as it has been mentioned above that you're likely to have mistakenly press the hidden button below the bitcoin discussion board icon written, all you need is to press the minus sign (-) to plus sign (+) in other to activate it back, also know that you're likely to have a different display if you log in using mobile version and your uncle using desktop to log in but that doesn't mean makes the reason to why the bitcoin discussion board isn't displaying, it's just a simple function of the mistake you made by clicking the hidden button.

comments.author: DdmrDdmr
comments.body: Quote from: Yogee on November 29, 2022, 04:06:32 PM<…>I would have thought this to be the case. It happened to me on a few occasions and got me wondering where the Bitcoin board had gone to for a few seconds.Incidentally, playing around with the feature now I’ve just noticed that toggling the +/- sign next to the section has a minor side effect on the News section on the top quadrant of the page: If changes the hyperlinks in the news frame to a text and the url within brackets. i.e.QuoteNews: Reminder: do not keep your money in online accounts (https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5421039.0)Nothing that you can’t revert by altering the url and trimming the "action" part or alike. If the OP is seeing the above in the News bar (instead of a hyperlink), then it’s definitively the toggled +/- section that makes the Bitcoin boards non-visible.

comments.author: Upgrade00
comments.body: Quote from: Ayebabara on November 29, 2022, 04:02:00 PMAfter my registration I forgot my login details, but today I was lucky to to recover the details.You should consider signing a signature to a Bitcoin address which you've posted on the forum, and stake that address here.This would help you should you lose access to your account a any time in the future.Quote from: Ayebabara on November 29, 2022, 04:02:00 PMWhen I login, and I saw my home page is different from my uncle's interface. There are some things that I saw in my uncle's own does not appear on my own. My home page starts from Economics but others start from Bitcoin discussion. As mentioned above, it could be that you have some boards on ignore or have played around with some features which made the other boards not visible.

comments.author: Mpamaegbu
comments.body: OP, besides the point that you could be having some boards under ignore and that's a possible reason you've less boards displayed than your uncle's; Let me quickly add that you need to do all you can to differentiate whatever wallet address(es) you want to use here from your uncle's so as to avoid anyone alleging that it's an alt account in future.

comments.author: Pillsike
comments.body: There are a number of reasons why this happened it's probably from your end though. Just try refreshing the page, if that doesn't work then clear the tab and start the whole thing afresh.

comments.author: Mate2237
comments.body: Quote from: Yogee on November 29, 2022, 04:06:32 PMCheck if you accidentally hidden the Bitcoin discussions boards. If that's the case then you should see a "+ Bitcoin" on the top left side of your screen under the "Bitcoin Forum" and just above the "-Economy". Just click the "+" sign to unhide the Bitcoin boards.That should be the case of the whole matter. Refreshing will not solve the matter but clicking on the + sign that appearing before bitcoin at the beginning of the page is best solution. I have faced such problem before and  I clicked the + sign and the board came back though I was trying to check (learning) things on the forum. There is another thing I also discovered in the forum that day was as I refreshed the page the Quote from: DdmrDdmr on November 29, 2022, 04:39:24 PMNews: Reminder: do not keep your money in online accounts (https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5421039.0) would changed to another news that has been posted before. So as I continue refreshed it different news were appearing.

comments.author: Ayebabara
comments.body: Quote from: Yogee on November 29, 2022, 04:06:32 PMCheck if you accidentally hidden the Bitcoin discussions boards. If that's the case then you should see a "+ Bitcoin" on the top left side of your screen under the "Bitcoin Forum" and just above the "-Economy". Just click the "+" sign to unhide the Bitcoin boards. It was not easy for struggle but I have finally gotten it. I follow the procedures you instructed me to do. It's like I mistakenly clicked the - sign unknowingly. I really appreciate your instructions. At least, many other users have also learned something new from my question.
